alert.note: Alert for Northern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued January 16 at 9:20AM EST until January 17 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, except locally around 1 foot in the far northwestern portion of the county. * WHERE...Northern Oneida county. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 5 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Steady light snow this morning transitions to heavy lake effect snow bands this afternoon into tonight. The highest snowfall totals will be across northwestern portions of the county in or around the Camden and Florence area. Snowfall rates up to 2 inches per hour are possible within the lake effect snow band this evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
